<alocascio> re: **@kevaundray**
> @amvlasov on the ACD call, it was noted that matterlabs uses the modexp precompile. Do you know what it is being used for in matterlabs and what bit sizes?

In our benchmarks, I believe modexp was one of the worse offenders. 

Its essentially a function that allows you to do modular exponentiation with upto 8192 bits (reference for others)
Coming back to the original question, the gas usage of modexp for proof verification in our contracts isn't too much, so this modification wouldn't have a big impact. '
